meanings.definition: To act as a sentinel or guard.
meanings.sent1: The soldier was sentinelling at the entrance to the base.
meanings.sent2: The security guard was sentinelling the building all night.
meanings.sent3: The cat took on the role of sentinelling the house from intruders.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse stood sentinelling the rocky coast, guiding ships to safety.
meanings.sent5: The vigilant owl sentinelling the forest, keeping watch over its domain.

meanings.definition: The act of standing guard or keeping watch.
meanings.sent1: The sentinelling of the castle was crucial for its protection.
meanings.sent2: The sentinelling of the borders was a task assigned to the most experienced soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel took on the role of sentinelling the nut stash from other animals.
meanings.sent4: The old tree served as a natural sentinelling point in the vast meadow.
meanings.sent5: The sentinelling of the treasure was entrusted to the loyal dog.
